tit.e: Goshui Wakashu (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry)
tit.cmt: 他と合わせ、タイトルの補足をいれました。

sen.j: 後拾遺和歌集（ごしゅういわかしゅう）は八代集の第四、『拾遺和歌集』の後継たるべく編まれた勅撰和歌集である。
sen.e: Goshui Wakashu is the fourth Chokusen Wakashu (anthology of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command) of the Hachidaishu (the eight Imperial anthologies of Japanese poetry), following "Shui Wakashu."

sen.j: 承保二年（1075年）奉勅、応徳3年（1086年）9月16日 (旧暦)完成を見、同年10月奏覧された。
sen.e: In 1075, he received the Imperial decree, completed on September 16 (in old calendar), 1086, submitted it to the Emperor for inspection in October of the same year.

sen.j: 構成は古今和歌集を基とし、春（上・下）、夏、秋（上・下）、冬、賀、別、羇旅、哀傷、恋（四巻）、雑（六巻）からなる。
sen.e: The poems were classified into the following categories based on Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry): Spring (two volumes), Summer, Autumn (two volumes), Winter, Celebration, Separation, Journey, Elegies, Love (four volumes), and Miscellaneous (six volumes).

sen.j: 巻二十（雑歌六）に収める「神祇」「釈教」の分類は勅撰集における初見。
sen.e: The categories of 'Gods of Heaven and Earth' and 'Shakyamuni's Teachings' in the twentieth volume (Zoka (Other Poetry) Six) first appeared in the Imperial anthologies.

sen.j: 選歌範囲は『古今』『後撰和歌集』以後、村上天皇朝から白河朝までの約130年間である。
sen.e: It contains poems which had been composed for about 130 years, after "Kokin" and "Gosen Wakashu" (Later Selected Collection of Japanese Poetry), which means from the reigns of Emperor Murakami to Emperor Shirakawa.

It contains poems that were about 130 years old, after "Kokin" and "Gosen Wakashu (Later Selected Collection of Japanese Poetry"), meaning from the reign of Emperor Murakami to that of Emperor Shirakawa.

sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。クォーテーションの位置を変えグレゴリオ暦を補足しました。

sen.j: この歌集は、絢爛たる王朝文化が衰退しはじめた頃、華やかなりし昔を振り返ったともいうべきものである。
sen.e: During the time when the gorgeous Dynastic culture began to decline, the selector compiled this collection of poetry, reminiscing fondly about the flowery old days.
During the time when the gorgeous dynastic culture began to decline, the selector compiled this collection of poetry, reminiscing in fond but flowery terms about the old days.
During the time when the magnificent dynastic culture began to decline, the selector compiled this collection of poetry, looking back on the splendid past.

sen.j: 主な歌人は、和泉式部（67首）・相模 (歌人)（39首）・赤染衛門（32首）・能因（31首）・伊勢大輔（26首）である。
sen.e: The major poets are Izumi Shikibu (67 poems), Sagami (39 poems), Akazome Emon (32 poems), Noin (31 poems), ISE no Taifu (26 poems).

sen.j: 一条天皇朝前後の宮廷で活躍した才女歌人が上位を占め、女流の比重も三割と大きい。
sen.e: Intelligent female poets who were actively involved in the Imperial court before and after the reign of Emperor Ichijo ranked high, and as many as thirty percent of the poets in the collection were female.

sen.j: ほかに、清原元輔・大中臣能宣・源道済・藤原長能・同藤原公任ら後撰・拾遺時代の歌人も重視されている。

sen.j: 和泉式部の激情がほとばしる恋歌から、赤染衛門の細やかな思い遣りの贈答歌、能因・良暹ら僧侶歌人の旅情豊かな歌、曾禰好忠の大胆な型破りの歌まで、その作者・作風ともに多様である。
sen.e: Poets and the style of poetry are diverse: Izumi Shikibu's love poem in which she expressed her passion, Akazome Emon's delicate zotoka (poetry exchanged between man and woman), poems appealing to the travelers' sentiments which were composed by priest poets such as Noin and Ryozen, and SONE no Yoshitada's bold and unconventional poem.

sen.j: また、詠歌背景を詳しく説明する長文の詞書が多く、散文的特色が指摘されている。
sen.e: Some pointed out that the collection is distinctive in that it contains a lot of long forewords to poems explaining where and why they were composed.

sen.j: 『後拾遺集』は、格調よりも率直な情感を重んじ過ぎたため、撰者が若輩の歌人であったこともあいまって撰進当時から批判の声が多かった。
sen.e: The selector of "Goshui shu" was young, taking frank sentiments too seriously rather than the refined style, so many people criticized the anthology when it was made.
The selector of "Goshui shu," who was young, considered frank sentiments too seriously but downplayed the refined style, so upon its introduction many people criticized the anthology.

sen.j: たとえば、歌壇の重鎮でありながら撰者の任に漏れた大納言源経信（1016～1097年）は、『難後拾遺』を著して論難した。
sen.e: For example, Dainagon (Major Counselor) MINAMOTO no Tsunenobu (1016-1097), who was not chosen selector, though he was a leading figure in the poetry circles, wrote a book "Nan Goshui" (A Criticism on Goshui Wakashu) to criticize it.
